long_description:
Midtown Manhattan is packed with landmarks and must-see sights, but not many command the same admiration from New Yorkers and tourists alike - Grand Central Terminal does. And what’s not to love about it? A time capsule in itself, the building has been standing since 1913, it’s the busiest and biggest train terminal in the world, and it’s downright beautiful.

Whether you’re waiting for a train or you’re just meeting someone who’s a tad late, Grand Central will keep you busy, entertained and well fed. Think of it as a small city within a city. Take a look at Grand Central’s map and explore a new site, grab a bite or overdose in architectural icons next time you’re there. Here are our top recommendations.

 

Oyster Bar & Restaurant

When a place has been open since 1913 and is still going strong, you can be sure they’re doing something right. Believe it or not, the specialty of the house are oysters! Fresh seafood, an extensive wine list and a lively atmosphere are also a big draw. We recommend visiting for Happy Hour.

Location
Dining Concourse (lower level), in front of ramps to the Main Concourse.

 

The Campbell Bar

If fine dining and cocktails are right up your alley, head to the historic Campbell Bar. This corner of Grand Central brings back the decor and sophistication of the ‘30s, while maintaining an air of exclusivity reminiscent of the Royalton Hotel.

Location
Balcony Level, West side.

 

Grand Central Market

Local produce and gourmet food from 13 carefully selected vendors will keep your belly satisfied. Even if you’ve been there a hundred times, seasonal foods will keep you guessing. This is the ideal location if you’re after some freshly baked bread, a huge cheese selection and high-quality products to cook at home or give to a friend.

Location
Main Concourse, accessible from Lexington Avenue.

 

New York Transit Museum Annex and Store

Rotating exhibits, seasonal events, such as the Annual Holiday Train Show, and tidbits of history await to those who visit. There’s also a store perfect to buy trinkets for that train lover in your life (or yourself).

Location
Main Concourse in the Shuttle Passage, next to the Station Masters’ Office.

 

Events at Vanderbilt Hall

Vanderbilt Hall is synonym of grandeur - one need only look up at the five stunning chandeliers hanging over the terminal’s main event hall. Check out the calendar of events to find out what’s happening - product launches are particularly cool!

Location
Main Concourse, across from Great Northern Food Hall and accessible from 42nd St

 

Manhattanites and frequent travelers to New York already know that Grand Central houses much more than our top picks. Next time you’re visiting the Royalton, take the four-block walk to Grand Central and rediscover this landmark - it never ceases to amaze.
